properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR NEED HEATING PLANT OR HOT WATER TANKS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO SMOKE DETECTOR NEAR HEATING PLANT OR HOT WATER TANKS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: MISSING C.O. DETECTORS AT 3159/APTS. 1 & 2
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO WORKING SMOKE DETECTOR PRESENT IN 2ND FLOOR APT OR IN FRONT HALLWAY AT TIME OF INSPECTION .
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO VISEBLE CORBON MONIXIDE DETECTOR PRESENT IN 2ND FLOOR APT AT TIME OF INSPECTION.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLR CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO SMOKE DETECTOR IN BASEMENT UNIT.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO CARBONMONOXIDE DETECTOR IN BASEMENT UNIT.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: MISSING AT 1ST FLOOR AREA.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR BASEMENT UNIT.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO SMOKE DETECTOR BASEMENT UNIT.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLR.NO CARBON MONOXIDE.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLOOR APARTMENT - CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR - MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: REAR STAIRWAY AT 2ND - SMOKE DETECTOR - MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 3104 N/. APT. 2N - MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.
Submit for approval plans prepared, signed, and sealed by licensed architect or licensed engineer and obtain permit for all but emergency repairs. (13-32-010, 13-40-010, 13-40-020)

Maintain building in safe condition so it does not constitute actual and imminent danger to public. (13-12-130, 13-8-100, 13-12-120, 13-12-125, 65 ILCS 5/11-31-1) Maintain building windows and doors in safe condition. (13-196-550) Maintain stairway and porch in safe condition. (13-196-570) Maintain floors, walls, and ceilings in safe condition. (13-196-540) Maintain building in safe condition. Premises now dangerous as vacant and open, uncompleted and abandoned, or vacant and boarded. (13-12-130, 13-12-125) Maintain watchman at vacant or open premises. (13-12-140)
Repair or wreck dangerous and vacant residential premises. (13-8-100, 13-12-125, 13-12-130)
Maintain watchman from 4:00 PM to 8:00 AM for vacant and dangerous residential premises. (13-12-140)

Register vacant building within 30 days of it becoming vacant, or within 30 days after assuming ownership of an existing vacant building. (13-12-125(a)). Building must be kept in compliance with all vacant building requirements pursuant to 13-12-135. See Vacant Building Ordinance and registration form at https://ipiweb.cityofchicago.org/VBR

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: SECOND FLOOR APT. AND ATTIC APT. MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 3149 B/BASEMENT, 3149B/APT 3, AND 3149B/APT 6 - MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 3129 B - BASEMENT MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: FIRST AND SECOND FLOORS,MISSING SMOKE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: FIRST AND SECOND FLOORS ,MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 2ND MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 2ND MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: ROOF TOP DECK- RAILS WEAK, DEFLECTING, LEANING, ANCHORED WITH NAILS ONLY.  POSTS ANCHORED WITH NAILS ONLY.  SOME POSTS BROKEN AND UNSUPPORTIVE.  GUARD RAILS EXTEND UP TO 8' WITH NO INTERMEDIATE SUPPORTS.  SOME RAIL SUPPORTS HAVE BECOME DETACHED.  RAILS SEPARATING FROM POSTS.  DECK JOISTS ARE 2X4 AT 2' CENTERS AND SPAN 4' BETWEEN SUPPORTS.  DECKS DEFLECT.  JOISTS ARE SAGGING.  AT SOME SECTIONS JOISTS ARE NO LONGER SUPPORTED AND DECK DEFLECTS DOWN TO ROOF TOP.  BUCKLED AND LOOSE DECKING.  TRIP HAZARD.  POPPED NAILS.  2X4 BEAMS AND JOISTS AND SUPPORTS (SOME INSTANCES OF 4X4 SUPPORTS AND SOME INSTANCES OF 2X4 SUPPORTS) ALL ANCHORED WITH NAILS ONLY.  SOME OF THE SUPPORTS FOR JOISTS AND BEAMS HAVE BECOME DEATCHED.  THE JOIST AND BEAM SUPPORTS AS STATED ARE 2X4 AND SOMETIMES 4X4.  THERE IS NO BASE FOR THESE TO SPREAD LOAD.  SUPPORTS ARE DIRECTLY ON TOP OF ROOFING MATERIAL.   OBTAIN COMPLETE PLAN AND PERMIT FOR ROOF TOP DECK.
